text.description:
Offering superb and stylishly modernised accommodation throughout, this splendid Georgian townhouse lies close to the city centre and within walking distance of the mainline station to London. Of significant historical importance- the house carries a grade II listing -and enjoying many features of the era, this versatile property is arranged over three floors and includes open fireplaces, panelled doors, sash windows, polished timber or quarry tiled floors to some rooms, together with thoughtfully added contemporary features such as a beautiful kitchen, bathroom and shower room. Offering impressive and airy living space throughout, the house occupies a south west facing plot and includes the additional benefit of off street parking to the front - the house is set well back from the road - and has a detached garage to the rear.
The restoration of this important property resulted in a 'Civic Society' Commendation in 2008 - and needs viewing to fully appreciate the sensitivity used in its modernisation.

Superb Grade II Listed Georgian Townhouse
Spacious Accommodation Arranged Over Three Levels
Fabulous Stylish Interior
City Centre Location
5 Mins Walk Of The Mainline Station
Gargage And Parking

The accommodation includes: Entrance Level : Hallway; Drawing room 13'7 x 11'11 approx; Sitting Room 13'7 x 12'4 approx; Dining Room 12'4 x 9'7 approx. Study. Lower Ground Floor: Kitchen / Breakfast room 15'9 x 14 approx; Family room / Bedroom Five 14'3 x 13'9, Utility Room, Shower Room. First Floor: Master Bedroom 13'7 x 12'1; Bedroom Two 13'9 x 11'1; Bedroom Three 12'5 x 9'7; Bedroom Four / Dressing Room 9'10 x 5'5; Bathroom. Garage accessed from rear. Newly lawned south facing gardens.

feature.heading: Kitchen/Breakfast Room
feature.description: 12' 6" x 8' 10" (3.81m x 2.70m) Fully fitted kitchen finished to a high standard wth a modern look.

feature.heading: Lounge Area
feature.description: 27' 7" x 14' 5" (8.40m x 4.40m) Large living area opens out into reception room/drawing room

feature.heading: Lounge (ReceptionDrawing Room)
feature.description: 13' 9" x 24' 11" (4.20m x 7.60m) Reception/drawing room comprises high vaulted ceilings. Idealas a dining room or for entertaining guests.

feature.heading: Bedroom 3
feature.description: 9' 6" x 10' 2" (2.90m x 3.10m) Smallest of the bedrooms. Still a good size. Ideal as a guest bedroom.

feature.heading: Bedroom 4
feature.description: 14' 5" x 12' 2" (4.40m x 3.70m) bedroom four is a larger guest bedroom. Ideal for entertaining a family. room for a double bed and cot/single bed if required.

feature.heading: Family Bathroom
feature.description:
Main Family bathroom comprises bath and shower, toilet and sink.
Heated towel rail also fitted.

feature.heading: Master bedroom
feature.description: 30' 2" x 12' 10" (9.20m x 3.90m) Large master bedroom with fully fitted wardrobes throughout. Room for plenty of furniture if required.

feature.heading: En Suite Bathroom
feature.description: En-suite bathroom for the master bedroom. Comprises shower, toilet and sink. Decorated to a high standard

feature.heading: Bedroom 2
feature.description: 23' 4" x 10' 10" (7.10m x 3.30m) Spacious second bedroom. Ideal for guests with fully fitted wardrobes.

feature.heading: Garage
feature.description: Double garage which is located across the courtyard.

feature.heading: Garden
feature.description: The rear garden looks out across open greenbelt pasture land providing an unusual setting so close to such major business and shopping centers. the front area is the shingle courtyard servicing these 'Cheshire Farm' barn conversions.
